subject: Music
title: Perfect Pitch vs. Relative Pitch
description: A 60-second lesson on Perfect Pitch vs. Relative Pitch.

hook.text: Mozart could name any note he heard instantly. Only 1 in 10,000 people can do that.

buildup.text: Perfect pitch means identifying or producing any note without a reference tone.

discovery.text: Relative pitch â€” recognizing intervals between notes â€” is far more common and trainable.

twist.text: Perfect pitch may be more about early language exposure than musical genius.

climax.text: Speakers of tonal languages like Mandarin are much more likely to develop it.

punchline.text: Perfect pitch is rare. Great musicianship doesn't require it.
